newsitem.title: USA: CBOT rice ends quiet session lower.
newsitem.headline: CBOT rice ends quiet session lower.

text.p: CBOT rice futures ended a quiet session lower on Friday, pressured by commission house selling, traders said.
"It was really slow," a floor source said. "Early selling from Dean Witter and (LFG) kept a lid on it all day. We had some local short covering on the way down."

Fundamental traders noted rice was trading at historically high levels with little bullish input to support it. Last year at this time, the May contract peaked at $10.00 per cwt. May closed at $11.69 on Friday.
Rice ended 10 to four cents per bushel lower with May off seven at $11.69.
Volume was estimated by CBOT at 400 lots, compared with Thursday's actual volume of 797 lots.
